item.title: The Future Of Religion? A Researcher Looks To Seattle For Clues
item.description:
The Future Of Religion? A Researcher Looks To Seattle For Clues

Marcie Sillman talks with Christopher James of the University of Dubuque about his study of new Seattle churches and what they can tell us about the future of religion.

item.title: 'Some Fell on Good Soil': Church Planting in Religious Ecologies
item.description:
'Some Fell on Good Soil': Church Planting in Religious Ecologies

In the midst of the decline of mainline denominations and the rise of the "nones" in the U.S. something surprising is happening. Church planting is booming.

item.title: Interview on RePlacing Church Podcast
item.description:
Interview on RePlacing Church Podcast

Dr. Christopher B. James joins Ben Katt to talk about his research on church planting in Seattle, including the unique dynamics of the so-called " None Zone," the four expressions of church that his extensive research identified (Great Commission Team, Household of the Spirit, New Community, and Neighborhood Incarnation), and the gifts and liabilities of neighborhood expressions of the church.

item.title: Practices for a Missional Church Planting Order
item.description:
Practices for a Missional Church Planting Order

What practices can sustain missional practice and spiritual vitality among church planters?

item.title: Academia.edu
item.description:
Academia.edu

Selected Articles on Missional Praxis, Spiritual Formation, and Congregational Studies.

item.title: Theologians study Seattle for future of 'church'
item.description:
Theologians study Seattle for future of 'church'

The Pacific Northwest is often called the "None Zone" because of the number of people who claim no religious affiliation. Yet, theologians and sociologists are paying close attention to churches in Seattle.

item.title: Perspectives on Ecclesiology and Ethnography (Review)
item.description:
Perspectives on Ecclesiology and Ethnography (Review)

My review of Perspectives on Ecclesiology and Ethnography edited by Pete Ward. Originally published in Missiology: An International Review.

item.title: Missional Acuity: 20th Century Insights Toward a Redemptive Way of Seeing
item.description:
Missional Acuity: 20th Century Insights Toward a Redemptive Way of Seeing

What kind of Christian spirituality is needed to foster and enliven missional living?

item.title: University of Dubuque Theological Seminary: Master of Arts in Mission and Discipleship
item.description:
University of Dubuque Theological Seminary: Master of Arts in Mission and Discipleship

Learn more about the Master of Arts in Mission and Discipleship at University of Dubuque Theological Seminary.

item.title: Education that is Missional: Toward a Pedagogy for the Missional Church
item.description:
Education that is Missional: Toward a Pedagogy for the Missional Church

What are the implications of missional theology for Christian religious education in congregations?
